meanings.definition: To dig up or uncover something buried in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist used a shovel to unearth the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent2: I will unearth the treasure chest buried in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to unearth his buried bone but kept digging in the wrong spot.
meanings.sent4: Her research helped unearth a long-lost civilization from the depths of history.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds unearthed a hidden layer of soil.

meanings.definition: To discover or bring to light something hidden or unknown.
meanings.sent1: We may unearth new evidence that changes our understanding of the past.
meanings.sent2: The detective hoped to unearth the truth behind the mysterious disappearance.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to unearth a rabbit from an empty hat.
meanings.sent4: Her persistence finally unearthed the key to solving the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The journalist's investigation aimed to unearth corruption within the government.
